body.title: EPPO-simple body content
body.p: General text, figures, and other body content follow a main body or section title to form the core of a topic.
Use the legend below to interpret the structure diagrams.

section.title: Structure
section.p: A body of content consists of a sequence of elements such as paragraphs, lists, figures, or other elements that would generally be presented as block components in a document. An EPPO-simple body-content group will have the structure shown in figure 2.

caption.p: Each component is optional and may appear any number of times, as indicated by the 0+ annotations.

section.p: Begin a body of content with one or more paragraphs, fragments, or fragment references, then follow with any mixture of those and other block elements.

li.p: a list, either ordered or unordered
